content: do it again yaya lovestoknit september 20 2024 the hats for sailors group on ravelry hosts monthly hat-alongs the september theme rib fest inspired me to look at this alternative rib stitch eyelets created with simple yarnovers add a little flair to the ribbing without being too lacy a good hat project for the adventurous beginner or intermediate knitter i knit this hat twice in different colors just for fun song of the day do it again steely dan 1972 https //youtu be/ycghtmv4yu8 size adult the two sample hats measure 8-8½ from top to bottom and 15½-16 around the bottom band unstretched the ribbing throughout this hat provides plenty of ease 1 | p a ge yarn both sample hats were knit using chic sheep by marly bird 100 % superwash wool 100 grams/186 yards per ball in crème de mint and leather crème de mint 67 6 grams 127 6 yards leather 66 3 grams 123 3 yards needles us 06 circular needles plus us 06 double pointed needles other tools stitch marker to indicate the beginning of round tapestry/darning needle to weave in yarn ends gauge 28 sts x 28 rnds = 4 square measured over the body of the hat unstretched abbreviations used k= knit round s = round s k2tog = knit two stitches together sl slip a stitch without knitting* p = purl st s = stitch es p2tog = purl two stitches together yo = yarn over psso = pass slip_stitch over *slip the stitch knitwise or purlwise as you prefer note straight brackets are used to set off a sequence of stitches to be repeated repeat the stitches within the brackets for the entire round knitting in this pattern there are 7 stitches in each repeat begin pattern using the circular needle cast on 98 sts taking care to not twist the stitches place the stitch marker to indicate the beginning of round and join to begin knitting in the round knit 3 rounds of stockinette to form the rolled edge if you don t care for the look of a rolled edge please feel free to skip this step bottom band p2 k2 p1 k2 repeat this ribbing sequence until band measures 1½ from bottom edge body of hat 1 p2 k5 2 p2 k5 3 p2 k5 4 p2 k2tog yo k1 yo ssk 2 | p a ge repeat these 4 rnds until the hat measures 6½ from the bottom edge for a slouchier fit knit additional repeats in the 2nd sample hat the dark brown i knit 1 repeat less for a closer fit crown of hat decreases in this section you will be reducing the number of stitches on your needles in order to form the crown of hat change to double pointed needles when there aren t enough stitches to knit comfortably with the circular needle 1 p2 k5 2 p2 k5 3 p2 k1 sl1 k2tog psso k1 70 sts remain 4 p2 k3 5 p2
